Package uk.pallas.systems.typr.entities.v1.validation.number

Interface NumberValidationRule<N extends Number>

All Superinterfaces:
ValidationRule
All Known Subinterfaces:
DoubleValidationRule, LongValidationRule
public interface NumberValidationRule<N extends Number> extends ValidationRule

    isValid(Number toTest)
    This will compare the incoming object and see if it is a valid whole number and if the value is a valid number do we have a maximum or a minimum data range? If there is a upper or lower value (they can be null) then it tests the supplied object is less than/equal or greater than/equal as appropriate.

    Methods inherited from interface uk.pallas.systems.typr.entities.v1.validation.ValidationRule

    getDescription, isValid, setDescription

  • Method Details

    • getUnit

      String getUnit()
      If the field is measured within a specific unit this will identify the unit allowing dynamic translation.
      Returns:
      UNDEFINED is no unit is specified/required.

    • setUnit

      void setUnit(String unit)
      Allows you to specify a specific unit for the numeric field value.
      Parameters:
      unit - null/invalid will result in the field being set to UNDEFINED

    • getMaximumValue

      N getMaximumValue()
      Retrieves the maximum alue that the field definition allows.
      Returns:
      null is allowed (or a valid Long value)

    • setMaximumValue

      void setMaximumValue(N maximum)
      Sets the maximum value (can be null) for the field definition to apply to the data field during validation.
      Parameters:
      maximum - the maximum possible value

    • getMinimumValue

      N getMinimumValue()
      Retrieves the minimum value that the field definition allows.
      Returns:
      null is allowed (or a valid Long value)

    • setMinimumValue

      void setMinimumValue(N minimum)
      Sets the mainimum value (can be null) for the field definition to apply to the data field during validation.
      Parameters:
      minimum - the minimum possible valid value

    • isValid

      boolean isValid(Number toTest)
      This will compare the incoming object and see if it is a valid whole number and if the value is a valid number do we have a maximum or a minimum data range? If there is a upper or lower value (they can be null) then it tests the supplied object is less than/equal or greater than/equal as appropriate.

      If validationOptional is set to true this will return true by default (no further checks).

      Parameters:
      toTest - to test is valid
      Returns:
      false if the object isn't a number or if it falls out the expected data range.
